form.name: form1

span.p:
In observance of the state-mandated school closure order, Danbury School will close and transition to our Remote Instruction Plan beginning on Monday, March 16th through the end of the school year.
Please see http://bit.ly/DanburyCOVID19 for details and updates. Thank you and stay healthy!

br.span:
Please see Mrs. Buehler's latest update regarding the 2019-20 school year. For more details or a printable version, please visit our website: http://bit.ly/DanburyCOVID19
Date: 4.22.20
Re: Schooling Update
To: Community Stakeholders
Laker Family:
On Monday, Governor DeWine announced that PK-12 school buildings will be closed to students for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. While this information is disappointing, this did not come as a surprise. The Governor encourages our school, as well as the other school districts across the state, to continue their "amazing" remote instruction arrangements to finish out this school year.
With that being said, Danbury Local School District will continue with our online/remote learning plan through the end of this school year. Teaching and learning will conclude on Thursday, May 21, 2020 (the originally scheduled last day of school).
The Danbury Local Meal Service will continue through May 21st.
The last day of school for high school seniors will be Monday, May 11th. Our original commencement date of May 17th has been postponed with tentative dates set for June 14, July 12, and August 9, as we are looking at all possible options for our High School commencement ceremony. We continue to be focused and determined to provide this opportunity for our students, their families, our staff, and community. Once the current restrictions are lifted, we will work in conjunction with state and local health, government, and educational agencies to ensure we can hold a safe, in-person ceremony for the Class of 2020. In addition, the senior scholarship/senior awards night program may also be celebrated as part of our commencement ceremony.
It is important that our students remain focused on their learning for our remaining school days. The work students are completing will continue to count toward their 4th nine week and semester grades as well as fall athletic eligibility. Our teachers will continue to work with students to make sure they have the essential skills they need to be successful moving forward.
Due to schools closing for the remainder of the year, all sporting events are also cancelled for the remainder of the Spring. More information will be given at a later date as to when athletic practices, camps, and competition may resume. Until then, the school will remain closed to our teams. More information will also be given on the free physical night which takes place in the Summer as it becomes available.
There are still many details to process through as we think about commencement, collecting Chromebooks, cleaning out student desks and cubbies, Kindergarten round-up, fall sports, scheduling, instruction in the fall, and much more…. we will be sure to do our very best to keep all informed as decisions are made.
Our staff continue to deliver a high-quality, creative, innovative, and personal approach of learning to our students each day. Thank you to each of them for their commitment to our students and their learning. To our custodial staff for their continual efforts in keeping our buildings clean, our incredible cafeteria staff for continuing to prepare meals for our students, our secretaries for their daily assistance with parents, phone calls, emails, and staff needs, and our administrators, working tirelessly, continuing to go above and beyond…. I couldn’t be more proud and honored to work alongside our Danbury team!
Be safe, healthy, and know that we miss our Lakers!
Mrs. Buehler
Date: 4.10.20
Re: Schooling Update
To: Community Stakeholders

div.a: Seniors: Josten's Cap & Gown Pick-Up Information:

span.div: On Wednesday, April 29th from 9:00 a.m.-11:00 a.m. Josten’s will be distributing senior caps, gowns, announcements, & other graduation items in a drive thru format in front of the athletic lobby. Students may enter the west entrance parking lot by the football practice field and drive up to the athletic lobby entrance to get their items. Students may only pick up items that have been paid for in full. You can bring cash (sorry, no checks) on the 29th or you can go online to the Josten's website and pay by using a credit card. Once you have received your graduation items you will exit the school parking lot by the cafeteria. Students will not need to get out of their vehicle and all personnel helping to hand out your graduation items will have face masks and gloves for the protection of all parties involved.
Please see http://bit.ly/DanburyCOVID19 for information regarding our ongoing operations under the current stay-at-home order & school building closures.

Starting with next week's student meal pick up on Monday, April 13th, please remember to fill out the survey by Thursday at 10:00a.m. for EACH student in your household every week. Each individual student will receive five (5) different breakfast and five (5) different lunch meals. Follow the link for the survey here: https://forms.gle/WZpU8hDiYuAdPmW5A
Meal pickup will take place every Monday from 6-7pm located at the Athletic lobby doors!
Do you have questions for us regarding the meal pick-up process or household eligibility to participate? Feel free to call us at 419-798-5185 ext. 1022!!
Stay healthy! See you on Monday!

span.span: Due to social distancing requirements and stay-at-home orders in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Danbury Board of Education will transition to online meetings via Google Meet video conferencing. This change will commence with the Special Session scheduled for Thursday, April 9th at 4:00pm.

div.span: In compliance with public meeting regulations and guidance from the State of Ohio, the public is welcome to view the live video stream of these meetings. A link to the live feed for each meeting will be posted on this page:
before the scheduled start of each meeting. More details regarding access and technical support are available at the link as well.
The purpose of the April 9th meeting is for the board to approve the resolution around electronic meetings. In addition, the board will discuss future potential commencement ceremony dates.

span.strong: Danbury Local Schools will instill within each student a drive for personal excellence, lifelong learning, and a distinct set of core values that positively impact family and community.
